Subjective: Headaches for 2 months; worsening; right-sided; nausea; glare; no vomiting; no flashes; no fever; no headache in childhood; family history of migraines and cluster headaches; no stress; no coffee; no energy drinks; no smoking; no alcohol; no drugs; prefers dark room; no work or sports impact; no sleep impact.
Objective: BP: 120/80; pulse: 50/min; cranial nerves fine; fingertip-nose test good; arm and leg strength good; Romberg's normal; no neurological deficits.
Assessment: Migraine syndrome, susp. trigger: sun glare; no signs of cluster headaches or other conditions.
Plan: Start pain relief as soon as symptoms start: paracetamol 4x2, ibuprofen if necessary
Keep headache diary to identify triggers
Return sooner if symptoms worsen or change
